inlineContent.text: Mustache is a “logic-less” templating engine. The core language has no flow control statements. Instead it has tags that can be replaced with a value, nothing or a series of values. Below we document all the standard tags
Mustache renders a template with a context stack. A context is a list of key/value pairs. These can be represented by either a
or the reflection information from
. For example the following two objects will render in the same way

Initially the stack will consist of the root context object you want to render. When we enter a section tag we push the associated value onto the context stack and when we leave the section we pop that value back off the stack.
All tags are surrounded by a double curly bracket

. When a tag has a reference to a key, the key will be searched for from the context at the top of the context stack and the associated value will be output. If the key cannot be found then the next context down will be searched and so on until either a key is found or we have reached the bottom of the stack.
